createTable.remarks: A table to contain all information about orders

column.name: sub_order_number
column.remarks: In the event of ship to me, pickup, ship to store, the order creates multiple shipments and sub orders for each shipment. In such event, we need the

column.name: order_origination
column.remarks: To identify where the order orginitated, it can be mobile, web, CXML etc

column.name: order_origination_timestamp
column.remarks: Order origination timestamp, commonly used to capture CXML Origination Timestamp. Or the requester can send the date time too.

column.name: ordered_by_proxy_user
column.remarks: Proxy User who ordered this order for the user in ORDERED_BY.

column.name: order_status
column.remarks: PENDING_APPROVAL, REJECTED, OPEN, QUOTE, QUOTE_DISCARDED, QUOTE_COMPLETE

column.name: ship_complete
column.remarks: When it is true, the order will be shipped when all the items are ready to ship, and if the value is false then the items should be shipped as they are available. 1=true and 0=false

column.name: order_future_date
column.remarks: This is the field for the order where the customer can give the future date the order should be placed.

column.name: customer_id
column.remarks: Customer id to identify who has ordered

column.name: discount_amount
column.remarks: Discounted amount if applicable on order

column.name: notify_by_email
column.remarks: Email notification for customer for order status

column.name: notify_by_text
column.remarks: Text notification for customer for order status

column.name: invoice_date
column.remarks: Date of invoice when it has been generated

column.name: job_instance_id
column.remarks: Order Process is triggered as a Job which runs asynchronously, this is the job instance id

column.name: order_tracking_number
column.remarks: To track order by order tracking number

column.name: picked_date
column.remarks: Date of order has been picked

column.name: shipping_instructions
column.remarks: If any instruction for shipping order

column.name: user_name
column.remarks: username of user who placed the order

column.name: is_test_record
column.remarks: 1 indicate test record true, and 0 indicate false, not test records

column.name: locked
column.remarks: 1 indicate record locked true, and 0 indicate record not locked false

column.name: created_datetime
column.remarks: Date and time at which the record has been created

column.name: updated_datetime
column.remarks: Date and time at which the record has been updated

column.name: country
column.remarks: Fetches the country from country table

column.name: parent_id
column.remarks: Stores the D of the parent customer of this customer

column.name: cust_type
column.remarks: Stores the type of Customer (either 'C' for Company or 'I' for individual) A new type G for Guest should be added in enum

column.name: address1
column.remarks: Stores the address for the customer

column.name: city
column.remarks: Stores city name for the customer

column.name: state
column.remarks: Stores the state code or state name of the customer

column.name: zip
column.remarks: Stores the zip code of the customer

column.name: email
column.remarks: Stores the Email Id of the Customer

column.name: taxid
column.remarks: Used to have for Tax purpose. Should store as 2-way encrypted text

column.name: keywords
column.remarks: Stores all the keywords of the customer

column.name: external_ref_2
column.remarks: In case customer has CRM, then this would be CRM id

column.name: landing_page_url
column.remarks: This will store the id for the landing page which will be coming from two tables (CUSTOMER_DYNAMIC_PAGES and STATIC_PAGES). Based on selection of page name

column.name: ship_to_id
column.remarks: we need to store the ShipToId as we need both the ERP Customer Id and ShipTo Id for Order. For eclipse, the same shipToId can be used for different

column.remarks: In the event that the user is not registered when the user has come to the counter and this field is used to save the cart for future retrieval. In this case the user_id will be null. There will be two generic carts for every user: 1) Default Cart 2) Saved for Later

column.name: external_system_id
column.remarks: This could be the kiosk id

column.name: sales_rep_id
column.remarks: This is used when the sales representative is placing an order for a customer

column.name: cart_type
column.remarks: Web Cart, Kiosk Cart, Sales Rep cart, Saved Cart, Product Group, Promoted Product Group, Saved for Later, or RFQ cart

column.name: customer_group_id
column.remarks: Customer group id, only for Promoted Product Group

column.name: coupon_code
column.remarks: Multiple coupon codes can be used

column.name: is_test_record
column.remarks: 1 indicate test record true, and 0 indicate false, not test records

column.name: locked
column.remarks: 1 indicate record locked true, and 0 indicate record not locked false

column.name: created_datetime
column.remarks: Date and time at which the record has been created

column.name: updated_datetime
column.remarks: Date and time at which the record has been updated

createTable.remarks: A table to contain all information about cart share

column.name: allow_to_edit
column.remarks: Is other user allow to edite shared cart. Indicate 1=true(allowed), 0=false(not allowed)

column.name: allow_to_order
column.remarks: Is other user allow to order by shared cart. Indicate 1=true(allowed), 0=false(not allowed)

column.remarks: 1 indicate test record true, and 0 indicate false, not test records

createTable.remarks: A table to contain all information about cart's items

column.name: item_id
column.remarks: In the case the items are coming from Rockwell or External catalog, the item_id would be null and the below snapshot data will be captured

column.name: item_source
column.remarks: Web or Rockwell or External Integration

column.name: extended_price
column.remarks: Price for the entire line item (quantity * price of each item)

column.name: old_unit_price
column.remarks: In the case of price change and the job checks ERP on a scheduled time finds that the price has changed, then this field will store the old price and the new price will be updated in the unit_price

column.name: last_updated_by
column.remarks: In the case of shared cart, this field will have value for the user (user id) who updated this line item

column.name: sequence_number
column.remarks: Sequence of the items added to the cart

column.name: price_source
column.remarks: Where is the price retreived from
